info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 7:14PM MDT until June 06 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN SOCORRO AND EAST CENTRAL CATRON COUNTIES... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is likely underway. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dusty. The Bear Trap Burn Scar will be impacted by flash flooding, as well as Alamosa Creek, West Red Canyon, Wahoo Canyon, Silver Creek, and Corduroy Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Bear Trap Burn Scar. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
